person.persName: Thomas Brooks Fairleigh (Colonel 26th Kentucky Veteran Infantry and )

body.p: Brandenburg, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Brandenburg native. Graduate of the University of Louisville Law School in 1858. Attorney in Brandenburg in 1860. Captain in the 26th Kentucky Veteran Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from February 1862 to May 1862. Major from May 1862 to June 1862. Lieutenant colonel from June 1862 to August 1862. AAG on the staff of General Stephen G. Burbridge and General Horatio P. Van Cleave from August 1862 to November 1862. Post commander of Bowling Green from August 1863 to January 1864. Served on the staff of General Burbridge from March 1864 to May 1864. Post commander of Louisville from May 1864 to January 1865. Colonel of the 26th Kentucky Veteran Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from January 1865 to July 1865. Attorney in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1865.
